title: Law Cannot Control Luffy - Foreshadowing Alliance Complications
summary: Law's admission in Episode 622 that he cannot control Luffy, despite forming an alliance with him, foreshadows future complications in their partnership and suggests Luffy will make unpredictable decisions that derail Law's carefully laid plans.
fullText: In Episode 622, Law tells Smoker that contrary to appearances, he is not manipulating Luffy - rather, it's the other way around, and Law cannot control him. This moment foreshadows the future dynamics of their alliance, where Law's calculated strategies will repeatedly be disrupted by Luffy's impulsive nature. Fans theorized after this episode that Law's 30% chance of success against Kaidou would be complicated not by external enemies, but by his own ally's unpredictability. This theory proved accurate in later arcs when Luffy repeatedly acted against Law's plans, such as attacking Doflamingo directly and later challenging Big Mom and Kaidou simultaneously rather than following Law's more cautious approach.
author: Multiple One Piece Fans

title: Napoleon Historical Parallel: Trafalgar D. Water Law Connection
summary: The alliance to defeat Kaidou parallels the historical Coalition forces that defeated Napoleon, with key victories at 'The Battle of Trafalgar' and 'The Battle of Waterloo' - which connects to Law's full name: Trafalgar D. Water Law, suggesting his crucial role in defeating an emperor.
fullText: Following the announcement in Episode 622 that Law and Luffy's alliance aims to defeat Kaidou, fans drew parallels to the historical defeat of Napoleon Bonaparte. The Coalition forces achieved key victories at the Battle of Trafalgar and the Battle of Waterloo. Law's full name being 'Trafalgar D. Water Law' (with Waterloo potentially hidden in 'Water Law') suggests Oda planned this historical parallel from the beginning. The theory proposes that just as multiple nations banded together to defeat Napoleon, multiple crews and factions would unite to defeat Kaidou, with Law playing a strategically crucial role befitting his namesake. This theory gained traction when the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance formed, matching the historical multi-nation coalition.
author: One Piece Theory Community

source.title: Luffy vs Kaido: How Will Luffy Defeat Kaido? (Fan Theory)

title: Momonosuke's 'Failed' Fruit Was Intentionally Labeled to Protect It
summary: Theory that Vegapunk intentionally deemed Momonosuke's artificial devil fruit a 'failure' to prevent the World Government from using it, when in reality it's nearly as powerful as Kaidou's original fruit.
fullText: Following Momonosuke's reveal in Episode 622 and the later discovery that his dragon transformation came from an artificial devil fruit created by Vegapunk, fans theorized that Vegapunk's label of 'failure' was strategic misdirection. The theory suggests Vegapunk, knowing the government's potential misuse of a successful Kaidou clone, deliberately called it defective due to its pink color rather than blue. This allowed him to leave it on Punk Hazard where it could potentially be destroyed or fall into better hands. The fruit's actual performance - matching Kaidou's size and abilities when used by an adult Momonosuke - suggests it was never truly a failure. This theory aligns with Vegapunk's later characterization as someone who opposes the World Government's moral corruption while working within their system.
author: One Piece Fan Community

source.title: One Piece: Why Momonosuke's Devil Fruit Is Considered a Failure by Vegapunk

title: Luffy's Declaration to Defeat All Emperors Sets Up Final War
summary: Luffy's statement in Episode 622 that he will defeat all Four Emperors (not just Kaidou as Law planned) foreshadows the series endgame where all Emperors must fall for Luffy to become Pirate King.
fullText: When Law reveals in Episode 622 that their alliance targets Kaidou, Luffy immediately declares he will defeat all of the Four Emperors. Fans theorized this wasn't just bravado but Oda's way of plotting out the New World saga's structure. The theory correctly predicted that Luffy would eventually confront each Emperor: Big Mom in Whole Cake Island and Wano, Kaidou in Wano, Blackbeard as a final antagonist, and eventually even Shanks in some capacity. The theory suggests that the Emperor system represents the old order that must be dismantled for Luffy's new era of freedom and dreams. This moment in Episode 622 essentially provided a roadmap for the next several hundred episodes, with each Emperor representing a major arc.
author: One Piece Fan Community
